verses.esv:
17   A man of quick temper acts foolishly,
    and a man of evil devices is hated.
verses.kjv: 17 He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
verses.niv: 17 A quick-tempered man does foolish things, and a crafty man is hated.

verses.esv:
15:1   A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.kjv: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.niv: 1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.esv: 20 for the anger of man does not produce the righteousness of God.
verses.kjv: 20 For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.
verses.niv: 20 for man's anger does not bring about the righteous life that God desires.

verses.esv:
11   A fool gives full vent to his spirit,
    but a wise man quietly holds it back.
verses.kjv: 11 A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.niv: 11 A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

verses.esv:
29   Whoever is slow to anger has great understanding,
    but he who has a hasty temper exalts folly.
verses.kjv: 29 He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
verses.niv: 29 A patient man has great understanding, but a quick-tempered man displays folly.

verses.esv:
32   Whoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty,
    and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
verses.kjv: 32 He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
verses.niv: 32 Better a patient man than a warrior, a man who controls his temper than one who takes a city.

verses.esv: 19 Know this, my beloved brothers: let every person be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger;
verses.kjv: 19 Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:
verses.niv: 19 My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,

verses.esv: 26 Be angry and do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger, 27 and give no opportunity to the devil.
verses.kjv: 26 Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath: 27 Neither give place to the devil.
verses.niv: 26 "In your anger do not sin": Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry, 27 and do not give the devil a foothold.

verses.esv: 8 But now you must put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and obscene talk from your mouth.
verses.kjv: 8 But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.niv: 8 But now you must rid yourselves of all such things as these: anger, rage, malice, slander, and filthy language from your lips.

verses.esv:
18   A hot-tempered man stirs up strife,
    but he who is slow to anger quiets contention.
verses.kjv: 18 A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
verses.niv: 18 A hot-tempered man stirs up dissension, but a patient man calms a quarrel.

verses.esv: 19 Beloved, never avenge yourselves, but leave it to the wrath of God, for it is written, “Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.”
verses.kjv: 19 Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.
verses.niv: 19 Do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God's wrath, for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay," says the Lord.

verses.esv:
11   Good sense makes one slow to anger,
    and it is his glory to overlook an offense.
verses.kjv: 11 The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
verses.niv: 11 A man's wisdom gives him patience; it is to his glory to overlook an offense.

verses.esv: 21 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
verses.kjv: 21 Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
verses.niv: 21 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

verses.esv:
28   A man without self-control
    is like a city broken into and left without walls.
verses.kjv: 28 He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
verses.niv: 28 Like a city whose walls are broken down is a man who lacks self-control.

verses.esv:
24   Make no friendship with a man given to anger,
    nor go with a wrathful man,
25   lest you learn his ways
    and entangle yourself in a snare.
verses.kjv: 24 Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
verses.niv: 24 Do not make friends with a hot-tempered man, do not associate with one easily angered, 25 or you may learn his ways and get yourself ensnared.

verses.esv:
9   Be not quick in your spirit to become angry,
    for anger lodges in the heart of fools.
verses.kjv: 9 Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
verses.niv: 9 Do not be quickly provoked in your spirit, for anger resides in the lap of fools.

verses.esv:
8   Refrain from anger, and forsake wrath!
    Fret not yourself; it tends only to evil.
verses.kjv: 8 Cease from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.
verses.niv: 8 Refrain from anger and turn from wrath; do not fret-it leads only to evil.

verses.esv: 31 Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice.
verses.kjv: 31 Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice:
verses.niv: 31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice.

verses.esv: 25 Therefore, having put away falsehood, let each one of you speak the truth with his neighbor, for we are members one of another. 26 Be angry and do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger, 27 and give no opportunity to the devil. 28 Let the thief no longer steal, but rather let him labor, doing honest work with his own hands, so that he may have something to share with anyone in need. 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear. 30 And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption. 31 Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice. 32 Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
verses.kjv: 25 Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another. 26 Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath: 27 Neither give place to the devil. 28 Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth. 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers. 30 And grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption. 31 Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil speaking, be put away from you, with all malice: 32 And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
verses.niv: 25 Therefore each of you must put off falsehood and speak truthfully to his neighbor, for we are all members of one body. 26 "In your anger do not sin": Do not let the sun go down while you are still angry, 27 and do not give the devil a foothold. 28 He who has been stealing must steal no longer, but must work, doing something useful with his own hands, that he may have something to share with those in need. 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen. 30 And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, with whom you were sealed for the day of redemption. 31 Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. 32 Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.

verses.esv: 13 bearing with one another and, if one has a complaint against another, forgiving each other; as the Lord has forgiven you, so you also must forgive.
verses.kjv: 13 Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.niv: 13 Bear with each other and forgive whatever grievances you may have against one another. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.

verses.esv:
22   A man of wrath stirs up strife,
    and one given to anger causes much transgression.
verses.kjv: 22 An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
verses.niv: 22 An angry man stirs up dissension, and a hot-tempered one commits many sins.

verses.esv:
16   The vexation of a fool is known at once,
    but the prudent ignores an insult.
verses.kjv: 16 A fool’s wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.
verses.niv: 16 A fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult.

verses.esv: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
verses.kjv: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,
verses.niv: 22 But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,

verses.esv:
16   One who is wise is cautious and turns away from evil,
    but a fool is reckless and careless.
verses.kjv: 16 A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
verses.niv: 16 A wise man fears the LORD and shuns evil, but a fool is hotheaded and reckless.

verses.esv: 17 But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, open to reason, full of mercy and good fruits, impartial and sincere. 18 And a harvest of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.
verses.kjv: 17 But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy. 18 And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.
verses.niv: 17 But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere. 18 Peacemakers who sow in peace raise a harvest of righteousness.
